jobPostingInfo.title: News Events and Projects Producer-Writer
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

  • JPL's award winning Communications and Science Directorate is seeking an energetic and creative Producer-Writer to join the News Events and Projects Group.

  • The News Events and Projects Group, within the Communications and Education Directorate, is the glue that holds together the lab’s big news events, including launches, landings, and planetary arrivals. This is an opportunity for an organized, adaptable, collaborative individual who wants to shape some of the most exciting moments in space exploration and to learn something new every day.

  • As a Media Specialist III, this Producer-Writer will report to the Supervisor of News Events and Projects. You will keep big events on track, helping to develop the products and activities that need to come together in a fast-paced environment and coordinate among multiple groups.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Defining strategies for big news events six months to a year in advance

  • Turning those strategies into concrete plans, in collaboration with writers, video producers, media managers, spacecraft project managers, TV and Web teams, senior leadership, and NASA public affairs officers.

  • Ensuring products and events in these news and media plans are on track.

  • Producing news briefings and training speakers.

  • Providing guidance for video and live productions and reviewing scripts to ensure the activities reach the widest practicable audience for NASA/JPL news.

  • Writing and editing press kits.

  • Contribute to writing news releases and web feature stories.

  • Helping to run on-site media activities at JPL or mission event locations.

  • Coordinating media interviews.

Qualifications

  • Typically requires a bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications, or a related subject area, with a minimum of 6 years of related experience.

  • Demonstrated news judgment and the ability to find engaging storylines for a general audience and more specialized audiences when appropriate.

  • Broad understanding of multimedia news products and platforms so that the parts -- written stories, images, videos, media events, live shows, and social media activities – add up to a greater whole.

  • Strong writing and editing skills, especially in distilling complex science and engineering topics into appealing videos or live shows.

  • Proven track record of meeting deadlines and handling breaking news.

  • Excellent organization.

  • Ability to navigate multiple projects with multiple partners at the same time.

  • Ability to work both independently and as part of a team to manage and complete projects.

  • Demonstrated ability to adapt and learn quickly.

Preferred qualifications

  • In-depth experience in a traditional or digital newsroom.

  • Experience with broadcast and video production that includes story identification, coordination, and script writing.

  • Experience producing events.

  • Experience in project management.

  • Knowledge of Earth science, planetary science, and/or astrophysics.

  • Previous work experience with NASA or JPL.

  • Experience using Microsoft Office, G Suite, ShoFlo, Slack, and other business tools.

  • Experience with media-monitoring metrics.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
